name: Order of the Dwarven Fist (Fighter 12 / Monk 2 / Dwarven Defender 26)
author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Order of the Dwarven Fist



Image source: https://cdn.themis-media.com/media/glob ... mg/287.png

Lore:
The monks of the Order of the Dwarven Fist have an unusual upbringing.

Firstly prospective candidates are sent out, into the Underdark, amongst the ruddy dwarven fighters, clad in armor, equipped with tower shield, to help defend their cities.

But to prove their worth to the Order, they must abandon all thoughts of equipping that noble dwarven waraxe and rely on the power of the fist.

Which makes such candidates popular amongst the dwarven legion commanders, with their lawful nature and martial arts prowess, any post-battle tavern brawl usually ends with the Order candidates cleaning house and Order restored.

...

And once they have proven their worth with adequate military progression, they are finally accepted into the Order, finally earning their robes, and the power of the Monk Brotherhood....




Build notes:
This build takes ideas from Cinnabar Din's classic build, The Resistor, but makes adjustments:

- makes it an unarmed dex-based Monk for 6-8 APR
- takes Monk early pre-epic, to allow the player to equip medium armor and shield for better defensive capabilities, before finally donning their robes, and adding 1 BAB.
- takes DD 26 (18/-) and EDR III (9/-) for near maximum physical damage reduction (27/-)
- takes epic energy resistances 20/- in Acid, 10/- in Fire and 10/- Electricity (rather than 20/- fire, acid and cold)
- takes resist energy feats in Cold and Sonic to cover the other elements
- puts Int up to 14 for more skill points and for improved knockdown
- takes great fortitude, epic fortitude and luck of heroes (rather than iron will / lightning reflexes) to try to boost the fortitude save for resistance against dev crit and implosion with a fort 37(42) save. Add more resistance with a few cons / fortitude boosting items on top of it, good luck to those guys killing you. I thought this balanced the build a little nicer compared with taking more epic energy resistances.

It loses UMD and a little sneak attack, and the will and reflex saves are not quite as good. 

The base AB is still 40. The Monk UBAB makes it better.

As a soloist, this guy is almost certainly going to have clarity potions highly visible in the quickbar, no different to most non-UMD fighters. But give this guy an item with mind immunity, or that casts protection vs evil / lesser/greater mind blank and you are pretty much going to go into cruise control.

In a party this guy is where he truly shines, with 728hp (capped at 968hp), buffed with will protectors as described above, buffed with bull's/cats, buffed with cleric bonuses / bardic bonuses, with evasion/reflex 23(28) he can dodge a few fireballs and tank those dev crits and implosion users, if he rolls a 1, just res this guy and he will be at it again. 

His dexterity AC will be protected with dwarven defensive awareness I, and sneak attacks will be difficult against this guy with a both high spot score (listen is not effective, a successful spot check is required to stop sneaks from stealth), defensive awareness II (which gives flanking immunity, no sneak attacks from that) and a high discipline score to resist knockdowns if knockdown immunity is not available.

For style points he can also eventually use deflect arrows with a 95% success rate (DC 20) whilst tanking it up, the animation for that ability is simply awesome. Not that those arrows were ever going to damage him in the first place.

One can equip a kama by taking exotic weapon proficiency early on, or dropping 1 BAB for an early monk level (which increases saves in exchange), but fists have a certain style to them.

Pre-epic, damage resistant enemies (ie ghostly visage with +1 soak 5) might be a pain without monk gloves, but you can carry around a spare enchanted shortsword/handaxe to give these guys the smackdown then switch back.

Or if you want to cheat the Order, just keep that enchanted shortsword/handaxe equipped whilst the Brotherhood is not looking (they will never know...) until they award you those gloves.

Overall the numbers look great, it looks novel, very difficult to kill, and enough AB to play solo, so I'm going to share this one with you guys, in fact, I might start play testing this soon. 

Appreciate any feedback on suggested tweaks/improvements!

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: I have combined these classes before in my Order of the Stone Fist, but went with Monk 20 / Fighter 6 / DD 14 for 1d20 fists and other Monk goodies like +4 AC (and more frequent Tumble skill dumps), monk speed, spell resistance 30, and immunity to disease, poison, and all mental effects.  With only 2 levels of Monk, your fists do only 1d6 damage, same as a kama, so you might as well dual-wield kamas for 2 more attacks.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hail Empyre65! Thanks for reading through this build draft and commenting!

Improved two-weapon fighting (ITWF) Kama is always attractive in a low monk build, particularly in a BAB 30 build dex build for those two extra attacks.
Not only these are two attacks, the kamas free up the glove slot for something else, they can have flame weapon/keen edge/GMW cast on them as well.
As mentioned, a high Monk (16+) enjoys those powerful 1d20 fists plus all those other goodies.
I enjoyed reading through your Order of the Stone Fist build, and thanks for linking it for me to read.

I believe ITWF Kama comes with downsides as well in this particular build. 
To implement them in this instance, it would cost either 4 additional pre-epic feats (weapon proficiency exotic, two-weapon fighting, ambidexterity, improved two-weapon fighting) or -1 BAB by taking Monk 1 pre-epic (to avoid taking weapon proficiency exotic) and the three two weapon fighting feats.
There is -2 AB on top of this for dual wielding, which if flurry of blows is additionally used, a further -2 AB, which drops that base 40 AB down to base 36-38 in practice.
Being tiny weapons, they make the character susceptible to improved disarm attempts, which with a large weapon, provide a +8 bonus to AB to your opponent (compared with -4 AB if this character was wielding a large weapon or was unarmed). In some ways, if you resist the improved disarm attempt wielding a tiny weapon it is better for your opponent, as they will continue to enjoy massive (up to +40%) boosts to the chance to hit you and critical hit you.
In certain environments (ie against undead) bludgeoning damage is more favorable than slashing.
Some environments have rust monsters who can instantly destroy your equipped kama instantly if you hit them, whilst an unarmed monk will have no difficulty dealing with them. 
Of least importance for this build with all these resistances, deflect arrows cannot be used unless you have a free hand, so a dual wielding kama monk will have this feat disabled.

Because I designed this fellow to tank for parties, providing the occasional improved knockdown and have enough AB to solo effectively, I chose to not go down this path and took more defensive pre-epic and epic feats. I believe the ITWF Kama suggestion has merit if one wishes to play a more offensively focused build. 

If one goes down this path for this build, I would drop LoH for exotic weapon proficiency, great fortitude/resist energy x2 for ambidexterity/TWF/ITWF, and four of the epic energy resistance feats to boost up dexterity so the character can compensate for the -2 AB penalty for dual wielding. I think this is a very viable option to the player and thanks for suggesting it.
